words.example: The company hired a new employee to support the development team.
My manager approved the budget after a quick review.
Please check with your supervisor before changing the process.
The executive team set new revenue targets for Q3.
Our director will present the roadmap to the board.
The founder still mentors new hires personally.
We signed a strategic agreement with a local partner.
We gathered stakeholder feedback before finalizing the design.
The client requested a minor change to the interface.
Each customer can track orders in the app.
The vendor offered a discount for annual billing.
We brought in a contractor to speed up the migration.
A security consultant reviewed our firewall rules.
Our intern automated the weekly report with a script.
A colleague shared a useful testing checklist.
My teammate handled the API integration.
The auditor asked for access to the change logs.
The data analyst identified a drop in conversion.
The solution architect recommended a microservice approach.
The engineer fixed the CAN communication issue.
Our designer updated the component library.
The developer opened a pull request for code review.
The tester logged three critical defects.
The researcher summarized the latest findings in a brief.
The accountant reconciled last month's expenses.
The recruiter scheduled three interviews for Thursday.
HR published the updated leave policy.
Our lawyer reviewed the licensing terms.
The operator restarted the line after the safety check.
A technician replaced the faulty sensor.
Support resolved the ticket within an hour.
The assistant booked the meeting room.
The secretary sent out the meeting minutes.
The trainer ran a workshop on Git workflows.
My mentor suggested a smaller MVP scope.
The tech lead prioritized the backlog items.
The product owner clarified the acceptance criteria.
The Scrum Master removed a blocker for the team.
Our department is moving to a new floor next month.
The new division focuses on electric vehicles.
The assembly unit will add a weekend shift.
The safety committee meets every quarter.
The board approved the acquisition.
We will visit headquarters for training.
The Shanghai branch handles local sales.
The office will be closed on Friday for maintenance.
The welding workshop upgraded its PPE.
Inventory is stored in the east warehouse.
The factory runs three shifts during peak season.
The plant will shut down for inspection next week.
The lab needs new oscilloscopes.
The design studio tested new layouts.
The meeting room fits twelve people.
Visitors should wait in the lobby.
Please leave the parcel at reception.
I sent the monthly report to the whole team.
We submitted a proposal for the pilot project.
Let’s finalize the test plan by tomorrow.
Our budget doesn’t cover additional licenses.
The contract expires at the end of the year.
We reached an agreement after two rounds of talks.
Please upload the invoice to the portal.
Keep the receipt for reimbursement.

The quotation includes installation and support.
The memo explains the new approval flow.

We keep a record of all API changes.

Each slide has a clear takeaway.

Use this template for feature specs.

Create a ticket so support can track it.
Move low-priority items to the next backlog.
We reached the first milestone on time.
Each deliverable needs an owner and a due date.

Each requirement has a unique ID.

Customer issues take the highest priority.

Submit a change request for that update.

QA will run an internal audit next month.
The build must meet ASPICE compliance.
Let’s keep the meeting to thirty minutes.
Keep the standup focused and short.

Your interview is scheduled for 10 a.m.
Onboarding takes about one week.
Document the handover before you leave.
We scheduled the deployment for midnight.
The release notes list known issues.
We plan a maintenance window on Sunday.
The database upgrade requires downtime.
Data migration finished without errors.
Hardware integration starts next sprint.
Testing covers unit, integration, and HIL.
We spent the afternoon debugging a timing bug.
Please format your code before committing.
Write a clear message for each commit.
Resolve conflicts before you merge.
The nightly build passed all checks.
Publish the build artifact to the repository.
The CI pipeline runs on every pull request.
We added automation for regression tests.
Enable monitoring to track CPU usage.
Set an alert when latency spikes.
We opened an incident after the outage.
The root cause was a misconfigured proxy.
The postmortem lists five action items.
In the retrospective, we agreed to slice stories smaller.
This sprint focuses on stability fixes.
Each iteration should deliver a usable feature.
Our kanban board shows current WIP.
I’ll send a follow-up email after the call.
Ping me on chat if anything blocks you.
We use a messaging channel for on-call alerts.
You can reach me by phone after 6 p.m.
Let’s switch to a video call to debug together.
The annual conference starts next week.
Sketch it on the whiteboard first.
The printer is out of toner again.
Use the scanner to upload signed pages.
The copier jams if the tray is full.
The server rebooted after the patch.
The database stores audit logs for 90 days.
We moved most workloads to the cloud.
Cold storage is cheaper for backups.
Run a backup before the upgrade.
Push the code to the central repository.
Version control helps us track changes.

The legacy app still uses SVN.

Draft the report in Word first.

Try clearing the browser cache.
Connect to the VPN to reach internal tools.
Update the proxy settings for the new host.
The Wi‑Fi password changed this morning.
Network latency increased after the change.
Open the port on the firewall for SSH.
Each endpoint requires token-based auth.
Shut down your laptop during the flight.
The desktop has dual monitors.
This keyboard is much quieter.
Replace the mouse if it lags.
Calibrate the monitor for accurate color.
Revenue grew 12% year over year.
We aim to increase profit without raising prices.
Last quarter showed a small loss.
Shipping cost doubled this month.
Log each expense with a receipt.
Cash flow improved after faster invoicing.
The account balance updates nightly.
Record the entry in the general ledger.
The new servers are capital assets.
Deferred revenue is a liability.
Employee equity vests over four years.
Set aside funds for quarterly tax.
Our billing cycles run monthly.
We’re testing a new pricing model.
Send the customer a quote by noon.
We’ll purchase licenses after approval.
Procurement handles vendor onboarding.

We plan to bid on the maintenance contract.
Licensing terms limit redistribution.
Respect copyright when using images.
The patent is still pending review.
Use the correct trademark symbol.
Please sign the NDA before the demo.
This feature must follow GDPR regulation.
Her salary includes a performance bonus.
Payroll closes on the 25th.
The team received a year-end bonus.
One benefit is flexible working hours.
Submit attendance by Friday.
Your shift starts at 8 a.m.
Overtime requires prior approval.
I’m requesting two days of leave.
He’s on vacation next week.
We’re closed for the public holiday.
She took a day of sick leave.
Performance improved after refactoring.
Your evaluation is scheduled for March.
She earned a promotion to team lead.
A demotion should follow clear policy.
Discipline issues must be documented.
He submitted his resignation this morning.
Termination is the last resort.
Her retirement party is on Friday.
Recruitment will open two new roles.
The job posting goes live tomorrow.
We extended an offer to the finalist.
Offer acceptance is due by Monday.
New hires attend orientation on Day 1.
The deadline is 6 p.m. today.
Payment is due within 30 days.
Submit your timesheet every Friday.
We’ll rebalance workload across teams.
Current capacity allows two more features.
The forecast shows steady growth.
This quarter’s target is customer retention.
Our objective is faster release cycles.
A key goal is zero critical defects.
Our strategy is to deliver in small increments.
One tactic is to prioritize high-impact bugs.
Define a clear KPI for uptime.
Our OKR focuses on quality and speed.
The new facility opens in April.
The cafeteria now offers vegetarian options.
Lunch is available in the canteen from 11:30.
The pantry has fresh coffee and tea.
The nearest restroom is past the lobby.
Visitor parking is on the first level.
Please take the elevator to the 8th floor.
Use the staircase during fire drills.
Security will check your badge at the gate.
Don’t forget your badge when you leave.
You need access to the staging environment.
Safety training is mandatory for new staff.
Store equipment after use.
Wear PPE in the production area.
The first aid kit is by the door.
Follow the evacuation map during an alarm.
We’ll run a fire drill next Tuesday.
Join the morning briefing at 9 a.m.
Post an update in the channel when done.
What’s the current status of the fix?
Thanks for the feedback—it helps a lot.

Note the test setup for future runs.
Send a short summary after the call.
Start an escalation if production is blocked.

We reached a compromise on scope.

The resolution is to roll back the change.
